clinical_study.brief_title: Emotional Lived in Patients Suffering From Psychogenic Nonepileptic Seizures : Study by Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging

brief_summary.textblock:
Currently, hypothetical models of understanding Psychogenic Non-epileptic Seizures (PNES) involve emotional dysregulation.
The hypothesis of a disorder of emotional experience is mainly based on behavioral data and disturbance of autonomic responses in response to images in emotional content (Mignot et al 2015, in submission; Bakvis et al 2013). Various imaging studies have identified brain structures belonging to the limbic system in particular that seem functionally impaired in this population. These functional connectivity abnormalities are correlated with dissociation scores in PNES patients (Van der Kruijs et al 2012 and 2014).
Investigators propose to specifically study the brain activity of PNES patients during tasks emotional content to identify the mechanisms involved in this emotional dysregulation. This work is essential to understanding the mechanisms and the development of new therapeutic strategies

primary_outcome.description: To compare brain activity in emotional tasks by functional magnetic resonance imaging between the 3 groups: PNES, PTSD, healthy controls matched in age, and level of study

criteria.textblock:
Common Inclusion Criteria:
- Female Right-handed
- Mandatory enrolment in a social security plan
- Patient having signed an informed consent.
Specific Inclusion Criteria for PNES group
- Final diagnosis made by a neurologist specialist in epilepsy based on clinical symptoms and recording video-EEG.
- Absence of concomitant epilepsy Specific Inclusion Criteria for PTSD group Final diagnosis made by a psychiatrist and based on clinical symptoms DSM5
Exclusion Criteria:
common criteria for all groups:
- Neurological history or comorbidities (epilepsy included)
- On-going Neurological drug
- Change of dosage or introduction of psychotropic treatment of less than a month,
- Psychotic comorbidities (schizophrenia)
- Addictologic history except smoking,
- History of head trauma
- Mental retardation
- A person referred to in Articles L.1121-5 to L.1121-8 and L1122-1-2 the Code of Public Health
- Lack of control of the French language or ability to understand instructions
- Uncorrected visual impairment
- Contraindication to MRI: pacemaker, ferromagnetic foreign body, etc
- Autoimmune disease affecting the blood vessels
Specific exclusion Criteria for PNES group:
- Diagnosis of PNES challenged or denied by the patient
- Previous history of PTSD
Specific exclusion Criteria for PTSD group:
- Diagnosis of PTSD challenged or denied by the patient
- Disorder or antecedent conversive PNES
